1_1H8x2Aeu28Lnj6vhXFNZ32kpvGS6dnqWGA.body:
> [whacko](#comment_4_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): I think it should be made easier though... So you can just select which IDs you want to use rather than having to enter a seed. But a bigger priority imo (as mentioned in previous post) is truly decentralized idents.

you see the 0 trigger  hold it and drag it to the left  i think youll find this pretty usefull  :P

> [whacko](#comment_5_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): Ohhh, there is that but sadly it doesnt allow me to register another ZeroID when I set it to "Unique to this site" :( . To be fair, thats probably more to do with ZeroID rather than ZeroNet itself.

you must backup you ID (unique one ) put it elsewhere then create your ID ( you should ) it solve many issue

> [5thvortex](#comment_5_1BBH8wSFw4NF7sjvSBA8SsSvZA6cQYxUBq): you must backup you ID (unique one ) put it elsewhere then create your ID ( you should ) it solve many issue

also use another ID provider like kaffie or zeroverse
http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroverse.bit/
http://127.0.0.1:43110/id.kaffie.bit/

> [whacko](#comment_6_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): This is what Id like ZeroNet to improve on. Id like it so you can select multiple identities on the fly without having to move files about, would be much more convenient! That would work at least, so better than nothing!

you dont if u use different provider

> [les](#comment_1_1Gh8QNvw9tLK3UZ6znXCDLapCrtYhbjykL): great work guys! trying to put it on a odroid c2

the most efficient wayso far is to load a zeronet/Proxy ( install zero on a shard in plugin enable multisite) point your apps to this proxy

> [whacko](#comment_7_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): True! Will do that in future, I guess. Now all we need is a truly decentralized ID provider ;)

there is https://onename.com/

> [whacko](#comment_7_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): True! Will do that in future, I guess. Now all we need is a truly decentralized ID provider ;)

you could also enable multisite and ack has a proxy it will create a single key from there id wont be an issue

> [whacko](#comment_8_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): Perfect, just what I was looking for, thanks for flagging them up. Wish these would take off more, its much more in keeping with the ZeroNet philosophy. Getting there bit by bit, OneName looks promising too.

your welcome keep an eye on my list here has a flag found and upload 0site
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LQNHchUKBBtv5cguPuy92Cy7gLnZJCySs/

> [whacko](#comment_9_15eMfttUaaszDW39pJHosSc5bgZHuXMEaK): Definitely will, interesting times ahead for the ZeroNet!

yes has you can merge decentralize and centralize network also hooking it up to a decentralize router

3_12shzNwEsUKcdzbWYFNH54LJjKzQ7MUwhp.body:
> [bela333](#comment_2_12shzNwEsUKcdzbWYFNH54LJjKzQ7MUwhp): Thanks for the responses!I be honest, I'm not very proficient with decentrialited stuff, it just came to my mind, without knowing how possible it is.You can't really do this using signing, because everything happens on the client computer, so it can be manipulatedThe appendOnly tag seems like a good idea, but what I'm talking about could possibly be a bit more open, so it could do any type of validation. For example: checking if the user really did paid a set BitCoin amount.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/19q6BDmUvCS8xSiTmzqe6ADs9zMKxeE2GT/?Post:7:5thDecentralizer
